required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Surgical Facemask With the Double-trunk Mask on Oxygenation in COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Two Systems Above Low-flow Nasal Cannula on Arterial Oxygen Tension in Patients With COVID-19 : Surgical Face Mask Versus Double-trunk Mask

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the impact of two systems above low-flow nasal cannula on the arterial oxygen tension in patients with COVID-19. The two systems are the Surgical Mask (SM) and the Double-Trunk Mask (DTM).

detailed_description.textblock: Hospitalized patients with COVID-19 typically present with hypoxemia. In some patients, hypoxemia can be corrected with low flow nasal cannula. When placed above nasal cannula, some systems have demonstrated their interest in improving the performance of patient's oxygen delivery. For example, two recent studies have shown that adding a Double-Trunk Mask (DTM) or Surgical Mask (SM) above nasal cannula has the potential to improve the PaO2 despite no change in oxygen output (Duprez et al., J Clin Monit Comput 2020; Montiel et al., Ann Intensive Care 2020). However, there is no study comparing the relative effectiveness of these 2 systems.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing the randomized oxygen delivery system
primary_outcome.description: Oxygen tension (PaO2) in mmHg will be analyzed from a sample taken from the arterial system

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing the randomized oxygen delivery system
secondary_outcome.description: Carbon dioxide tension (PaCO2) in mmHg will be analyzed from a sample taken from the arterial system.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing the randomized oxygen delivery system
secondary_outcome.description: Potential of Hydrogen (pH) will be analyzed from a sample taken from the arterial system.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 30 minutes and 60 minutes after wearing the randomized oxygen delivery system
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate is measured during one minute by visual inspection.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 60 minutes after wearing the randomized oxygen delivery system
secondary_outcome.description: Dyspnea is rated with a visual analogic scale (0 to 100mm).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 30 minutes and 60 minutes after wearing the randomized oxygen delivery system
secondary_outcome.description: The O2 output will be adjusted to recover the baseline SpO2 reading. The O2 output will be read from the position of the ball inside the flowmeter.

arm_group.description: The standard oxygen delivery system (low-flow nasal cannula) is worn by the patient, without the DTM or the SM
The Double-Trunk Mask is placed above the standard oxygen delivery system (low-flow nasal cannula).
The Surgical Mask is placed above the standard oxygen delivery system (low-flow nasal cannula).

intervention.description: The standard oxygen delivery system (low-flow nasal cannula or oxygen mask) is worn by the patient for 1 hour.
The Double-Trunk Mask above the standard oxygen delivery system (low-flow nasal cannula or oxygen mask) is worn by the patient for 1 hour.
The Surgical Mask above the standard oxygen delivery system (low-flow nasal cannula or oxygen mask) is worn by the patient for 1 hour.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- COVID-19 positive
- SpO2 between 92 and 96% with low-flow oxygen therapy
- Oxygen output at baseline between 3 and 7 L/min.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pulmonary disease with hypercapnia
- Confusion
- Contra-indications to arterial blood gas sampling (peripheral arteriopathy, bleeding disorder)

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain
